title: Recognizing and Improving Teacher Self-Report Bias in Educational Technology Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational educational technology theories and survey design methods
context.additional_context: Process exploring multi-dimensional assessment tools while recognizing teacher self-report bias in smartphone-centric limited technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the concept of teacher self-report bias and provide three examples of its application in educational technology.
Learners can design five or more survey questions comparing "my practice" vs. "others' practice."
Learners can demonstrate procedures to verify the reliability of self-reported data through VR simulations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
